snippet: François Hollande, a Socialist who has made a point of trying to be a “normal president,” will auction off 1,200 bottles, buy more modest vintages and return the savings.
abstract: Elysee Palace in France says it will auction off 1,200 bottles of its finest wines, renew its cellar with more modest vintages and return surplus to state budget; move is part of Socialist Pres Francois Hollande's effort to contrast his simple style with that of former president Nicolas Sarkozy and help curb country's deficit.
lead_paragraph: François Hollande, a Socialist who has made a point of trying to be a “normal president,” will auction off 1,200 bottles, buy more modest vintages and return the savings.

headline.seo: Austerity Reaches France’s Presidential Wine Cellar
headline.main: Élysée Palace to Put Wine Up for Bid
headline.print_headline: Élysée Palace To Put Wine Up for Bid
